data.title: Post goofy off-model frames from early Simpsons
data.meta_description:

data.text:
P

Klasky-Csupo did all the animation in the first season yeah? It's weird because they are pretty very beloved for Ahhhhhhhhhhhh! A Monster, the McDonalds VHS tapes, and especially Rugrats. So weird they were super janky just a short time before they started producing every other cartoon that wasn't the Simpson's in the 90s...

I think they entered a partnership with Nickelodeon. And from the sounds of it the Simpsons team were not Klasky fans.

I don't mind the more traditional stylings of the early seasons, but season 7's clean and precise style will always be my favorite look for the show.

I missed the way that Bart's head would twist like this. Maybe the only quirk from the Klasky Csupo seasons that I look back fondly on, otherwise, I think I prefer the animation after that era.

P

I think they entered a partnership with Nickelodeon. And from the sounds of it the Simpsons team were not Klasky fans.

I don't mind the more traditional stylings of the early seasons, but season 7's clean and precise style will always be my favorite look for the show.

No, the Simpsons staff were fine with Klasky Csupo, it was James L Brooks and Gracie Films that didn't like working with them (and the feeling was mutual). It was because James L Brooks didn't understand animation at the time and wanted immediate changes. Unfortunately, reshoots aren't that easy in animation (especially during the cel animation days).

Klasky Csupo later animated Simpsons cameos in Duckman.

Aren't those in between frames? They are drawn like that intentionally and are "off model" by design.

Yeah basically it helps accentuate movement in animation with less frames being drawn. Most people won't see it but still is funny

Yeah basically it helps accentuate movement in animation with less frames being drawn. Most people won't see it but still is funny

Except in this case everyone saw it. Bart used to talk like that when he was saying something sassy. He'd turn his head to put a snap on a word and his mouth would stay facing the other way for a moment.

I believe cartoons who don't act in a way that's way that makes sense in 3D called a cheated angle; a well documented pheromone.

I worked on The Simpsons Game (the then-old-gen versions), and there was a lot of stuff in the design doc about keeping the characters correctly on-model despite having a free-rotating camera.

I didn't work on the feature *myself* - so specifics here might be a bit off - but if I recall correctly, on our version it was set up so the face would actually have an animation attached to it, moving the features appropriately - except the animation wasn't tied to time as you'd expect for an animation, but instead tied to camera angle; the end result, hopefully, being that the face always looked 'correct' as you spun the camera around the character.

Yeah basically it helps accentuate movement in animation with less frames being drawn. Most people won't see it but still is funny

It's called a "smear" and it's done all the time in 2D animation. A lot of the time it's used for motion effects, if something is moving quickly, but can be used for other purposes, too.

The Art of the Smear: A Secret Animation Trick - Ceros Inspire

How do you animate movement without drawing every step frame-by-frame? The animation smear, as seen on Spongebob and The Simpsons.

It's called a "smear" and it's done all the time in 2D animation. A lot of the time it's used for motion effects, if something is moving quickly, but can be used for other purposes, too.

The Art of the Smear: A Secret Animation Trick - Ceros Inspire

How do you animate movement without drawing every step frame-by-frame? The animation smear, as seen on Spongebob and The Simpsons.

Wow TIL thanks for posting.

Not really "goofy" but I love this superdeformed look with the big heads from the early seasons, there was a specific animation team that did this that they phased out when they started to streamline the art style, but it's great.

This is the BEST Simpson animation style, I extremely love when their eyes go slightly offcenter or the eye globe or pupil grow a little bit more than they should sometimes.

i feel like people never talk about how off model lenny is in the episode Homer's Enemy

its like this for multiple shots. They're not supposed to have these tall eyes.

Oh man, I hope Lenny is ok.
